alert.note: Alert for Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:37PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coconino County through 600 PM MST... At 536 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Page, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Page, Big Five, LeChee, Lees Ferry, Antelope Canyon Near Sr 98, Wahweap, Antelope Creek Basin and Waterholes Canyon. This includes the following highways... State Route 98 between mile markers 548 and 549. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 537 and 556. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Lake Powell, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward
